disease.name: Mirialan Skin Hypersensitivity Syndrome
disease.description: Mirialan Skin Hypersensitivity Syndrome is a condition unique to Mirialans, characterized by extreme sensitivity of the skin to various stimuli.

treatment_plans.name: Topical Treatments
treatment_plans.description: Prescribe topical creams or ointments containing anti-inflammatory or soothing ingredients to relieve itching, redness, and irritation of the skin.

treatment_plans.name: Antihistamines
treatment_plans.description: Administer oral antihistamine medications to reduce allergic reactions and alleviate symptoms such as itching, swelling, and hives.

treatment_plans.name: Avoidance of Triggers
treatment_plans.description: Educate the individual on identifying and avoiding triggers that exacerbate skin sensitivity, such as harsh chemicals, certain fabrics, or exposure to sunlight.

treatment_plans.name: Moisturizing Regimen
treatment_plans.description: Recommend a moisturizing regimen using gentle, hypoallergenic skincare products to hydrate the skin and prevent dryness and flakiness.

treatment_plans.name: Phototherapy
treatment_plans.description: Consider phototherapy treatments using UVB light to help reduce skin inflammation and improve symptoms. Phototherapy sessions are carefully monitored to minimize the risk of sunburn and skin damage.
